Description: This 10 year old, vintage hot rod Epiphone Goth G-400 is one of the most menacing looking guitars you’ll find. Bathed in Satin Pitch Black and dark (stunning) Rosewood fretboard with Seymour Duncan Nazgûl / Sentient Humbucker Set and black nickel hardware, this Goth G-400 is truly a one of a kind, a mean rock and roll animal. Besides upgrading the pickups, I also upgraded with a Gunstreet wiring harness (CTS 500K pots and Orange Drop capacitors), a Shadow black pickup ring tuner like Epiphone's Slash AFD Les Paul guitars, and a Graph Tech Black TUSQ XL Slotted Nut. As you can see from the pictures, the plastic is still on the rear cavity cover. There are some minor pick marks on the pickguard; but that's what it's there for. The SG or "Solid Guitar" has been called the "fretless wonder" for its low frets and fast action. It's been the go-to guitar for rockers like Pete Townshend, Tony Iommi, Paul Weller, Angus Young, Eric Clapton, and Derek Trucks. I ship to the lower 48 United States. If you have other shipping requirements or want to pick this guitar up locally, please contact me prior to purchase to discuss.
Title: Epiphone SG (G-400) Goth

Value: Seymour Duncan Nazgûl/Sentient Humbuckers, $189; Upgraded Gunstreet wiring harness, $65; Shadow Pickup Ring Tuner, $25; Graph Tech TUSQ XL Slotted Nut, $12.
